programmes.show_description: Brains. 1971. Stars Adam Faith, Iain Cuthbertson, Georgina Hale. Budgie's onto something big. It means 'Playing at Home' in Watford for a change and seeing his wife Jean.
2000. Romance. Director: Michael Winterbottom. Stars Peter Mullan, Milla Jovovich & Wes Bentley. A man who sold his wife and daughter to get ahead in business has his past come back to haunt him.
1953. Comedy. Director: Lawrence Huntington. Stars Michael Denison, Dulcie Gray & Sydney Tafler. A diamond merchants' secretary gets fired by her new boss for being too efficient.
1959. The Saddle. Western with Peter Breck. After his brothers are killed in a shootout, a gunfighter decides to hang up his guns and uphold the law by becoming a lawyer.
Reginald Foort is at the organ and wants you to sing a long. This song is The Strand.
1963. Drama. Jack Moir (Conrad Phillips of 'William Tell' fame), a newspaper reporter, is framed by 'The Duke' (George Pastell), a Soho racketeer against whom he has written a series of articles.
1946. Documentary. Directed by Cecil H. Williamson. Narrated by Valentine Dyall. A newly discovered film covering the fascinating story of The Tower of London.
1960. Crime. Directed by Edward L. Cahn. Stars Joan Evans, Ron Foster & Merry Anders. An ex-convict finds romance with the widow of his former accomplice as he attempts to collect his hidden loot.
1950. Action. Director: Godfrey Grayson. Stars Don Stannard, Tamara Desni & George Ford. Dick Barton is assigned to find a kidnapped professor and deactivate a death ray before catastrophe occurs.
1941. Comedy Horror. Director: Walter Forde. Starring Arthur Askey, Richard Murdoch & Kathleen Harrison. High jinks and chills ensue when a group of people become stranded at an isolated station.
1952. Comedy. Director: Ronald Neame. Stars Alec Guinness, Glynis Johns & Valerie Hobson. A man finds ways to rise through the ranks in business and social standing, some honest, some not.
The Getaway - Part 1. 1974. Stars John Barron, Jonathan Elsom & John Flanagan. Phil McDowell is on trial for the abduction of Fiona Sumner, a fourteen year old girl. He denies the offense.
The Getaway - Part 2. 1974. Stars Lyndon Brook, Elizabeth Weaver & Tina Heath. Fiona Sumner tells the court she initially agreed to go with McDowell but later changed her mind.
The Getaway - Part 3. 1974 Stars John Flanagan, John Barron & Lyndon Brook. Son of Philip McDowell tells the court that Fiona wanted to go on the trip to visit her father who she thought was dead.
1954. Mystery. Directed by Terence Fisher. Stars Paulette Goddard & William Sylvester. A man returns home after being missing for three years to find those responsible for the attempt on his life.
1968. A glimpse into the life of Eugene Kaufeler, one of the top chefs in London.
Chris Robinson's Premonitions/Pete the Poltergeist. 1994. Michael Aspel introduces more stories of the unexplained, including the touching tale of a poltergeist who haunted a couple in Cardiff.
Crisis. 1972. Stars Hilary Tindall, Robin Chadwick & Annette Andre. The strike by the dock workers spells potential disaster and the financial crisis in Hammond Transport becomes more severe.
Root of Evil. 1957. Stars Donald Gray, Diana Decker & John Longden. A paper manufacturer finds his safe broken into but does not want to call the police. His wife calls Mark Saber to investigate.

programmes.show_name: The Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club
programmes.show_description: Episode 24. 1975. Gene Pitney performs 'Half Heaven Half Heartache' and 'Blue Angel'. Plus, there's performances from Paul Daniels, Royal Polynesian Revue and Rivendell.
1980. Horror. Director: Alastair Reid. Stars David Hemmings, Lisa Harrow & Diana Dors. Dr Henry Jekyll experiments on his own personality, resulting in a terrifying struggle between good and evil.
1960. Horror. Stars Derek Bond & Bryan Coleman. In WW2, British soldiers are captured by the Japanese and have their hands removed. Years later, someone is removing the hands of people in London.
1960. The Last Train. Directed by Geoffrey Muller. Starring Russell Napier, Norman Johns and Lisa Daniely. Duggan investigates a murder in the London Underground. (S1, E33)
Hidden Scars - Part 1. 1974. Stars Maureen Lipman, Godfrey Quigley & William Mervyn. The bursar of a charitable school is accused of misusing funds though investments and using the money himself.
Hidden Scars - Part 2. 1974. Stars Terrance Hardiman, Stephen Murray & Ann Castle. Cresswell's wife let slip that she advised the defendant to invest in Metalia on behalf of his disabled daughter.
Hidden Scars - Part 3. 1974. Stars Liz Smith, Stefan Gryff & Morris Perry. Fowkes says charitable money could be given to his daughter. His wife said the money was from a generous friend.
1950. Drama. Directed by Nicholas Ray. Stars Humphrey Bogart & Gloria Grahame. When a screenwriter is accused of murder his neighbour comes to his rescue, but she soon starts to have her doubts.
Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not to be missed at the end of February and beginning of March.
1963. Who Killed Billy Jo? Directed by Hy Averback. Stars Gene Barry, Gary Conway & Regis Toomey. A recording star is murdered. Was the killer his agent, sister, music arranger, or someone else?
1960. A Question Of Courage. Stars Michael Ansara, Claude Atkins & Patricia Donahue. Sam investigates a series of shootings after reading an anonymous letter about the incompetence of the sheriff.
Take a trip to the 60s as Colette Magny performs the song Basin St Blues.
1949. Drama. Director: Louis King. Stars Dick Powell, Evelyn Keyes & J.M Kerrigan. Kathy O'Fallon meets Mountie Mike Flannigan. They fall in love, but can their love survive?
1956. Drama. Directed by Brian Desmond Hurst. Stars Donald Sinden, Anna-Maria Sandri & Anthony Steel. After the war, a young man sets out in search of his missing older brother.

programmes.show_name: The Wrong Arm Of the Law
programmes.show_description: 1963. Comedy. Director: Cliff Owen. Stars Peter Sellers, Lionel Jeffries, Bernard Cribbins & Nanette Newman. A gangster learns of a traitor in his midst and makes a deal with the police.
1960. The Dover Road Mystery. Directed by Gerard Bryant. Starring Geoffrey Keen, Edward Cast and Leonard Sachs. A stolen car used in a bank robbery proves too fast for the squad car. (S1, E32)
Never Back Losers. 1961. Directed by Robert Tronson. Stars Jack Hedley, Jacqueline Ellis & Patrick Magee. An insurance investigator tackles a vicious gambling ring.
1965. Adventure. Directed by Richard Brooks. Stars James Mason, Peter O'Toole & Curt Jurgens. A discredited seaman, desperately seeking to redeem himself, agrees to deliver a dangerous shipment.
Brother and sister duo Inez and Charlie Foxx perform the spectacular hit Mockingbird.
1963. Crime drama directed by Ernest Morris and starring Paul Maxwell, Clare Owen and Anita West. Waiting for his flight home from Baghdad, Bill takes a message from a British secret agent.
1947. Thriller. Director: Sidney Gilliat. Stars Trevor Howard, Sally Gray & Rosamund John. Against a background of bombing raids, a series of murders take place in a hospital during WW2.
Contraband. 1962. Stars Joseph Brady, Brian Blessed & Stratford Johns. PC Smith meets a stranger selling suspicious wristwatches. The captain assigns him and PC Weir to stake out the dock.
Tonight, at the Cellar Club, Caroline Munro is here to introduce the second episode of Supernatural!
Countess Ilona. 1977. Stars Billie Whitelaw, Ian Hendry & John Fraser. Countess Ilona invites four gentlemen to her castle but the men are not expecting what she has planned for them.
Caroline Munro is back to introduce tonight's film: Messiah of Evil. Prepare for this 1970s horror, full of strange and supernatural happenings.
1974. Horror. Director: Willard Huyck & Gloria Katz. Stars Micheal Greer, Marianna Hill & Joy Bang. A young woman finds a mysterious undead cult while searching for her missing artist father.
